intro: Orthosiphon macrocheilus, commonly known as the large-lipped horsegram, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Its flowers are typically pale blue or violet, clustered in whorls along the stems, and are borne in the axils of the leaves. Orthosiphon macrocheilus is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
